question: If x ∈ A ∩ B, then x ∈ A. This is...
choices: true for all sets A and B
true for some sets A and B
false for all sets A and B
explanation: By definition of intersection, an element is in A ∩ B if and only if it is in A and in B. Therefore, it must be in A.

question: For all positive integers n, if n! < -10, then n > 8.
explanation: True by vacuous truth. A factorial of a positive integer is never negative, so the premise n! < -10 is false. A conditional with a false premise is vacuously true.
